sourcing.instructions: Cobalt (Co) - Metal suppliers or online chemical vendors; Neodymium (Nd) - Rare earth metal suppliers; Phosphorus (P) - Chemical supply companies; Ruthenium (Ru) - Precious metal suppliers; Yttrium (Y) - Material science suppliers.
steps: Cobalt (Co) - Metal suppliers or online chemical vendors; Neodymium (Nd) - Rare earth metal suppliers; Phosphorus (P) - Chemical supply companies; Ruthenium (Ru) - Precious metal suppliers; Yttrium (Y) - Material science suppliers.

1. Weigh out each ingredient accurately using a digital scale. 2. In a clean, dry mixing container, combine Co, Nd, P, Ru, and Y. 3. Use a mechanical mixer or mortar and pestle to achieve a homogeneous mixture. 4. Ensure that the mixture is free of lumps and evenly distributed.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Weigh out each ingredient accurately using a digital scale. 2. In a clean, dry mixing container, combine Co, Nd, P, Ru, and Y. 3. Use a mechanical mixer or mortar and pestle to achieve a homogeneous mixture. 4. Ensure that the mixture is free of lumps and evenly distributed.

steps: 1. Preheat a high-temperature furnace to 1200°C. 2. Transfer the mixed powder into a suitable crucible for high-temperature processing. 3. Place the crucible in the furnace and maintain the temperature for 2 hours to ensure proper alloy formation.
heating.raw_text: 1. Preheat a high-temperature furnace to 1200°C. 2. Transfer the mixed powder into a suitable crucible for high-temperature processing. 3. Place the crucible in the furnace and maintain the temperature for 2 hours to ensure proper alloy formation.

steps: 1. After heating, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down naturally to room temperature (approximately 2-3 hours). 2. Avoid rapid cooling to prevent cracking.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After heating, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down naturally to room temperature (approximately 2-3 hours). 2. Avoid rapid cooling to prevent cracking.

steps: 1. Remove the solidified material from the crucible carefully. 2. Use a diamond saw or grinder to cut the sample to the desired dimensions (3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches). 3. Sand the edges to smooth any rough surfaces. 4. Optionally, apply a protective coating to enhance durability.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Remove the solidified material from the crucible carefully. 2. Use a diamond saw or grinder to cut the sample to the desired dimensions (3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches). 3. Sand the edges to smooth any rough surfaces. 4. Optionally, apply a protective coating to enhance durability.
